name: Hampton Inn Denver - International Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Hampton Inn DIA many times before flights the following morning. The most appealing thing about it is the dependable airport shuttle which runs on a every-45-minute schedule (as opposed to "on-demand" types). Other wise, it has seen better days. Worn and dirty carpeting and an unconcerned staff really hurt this formerly excellent property. Literally NO counter space in bathrooms. Breakfast is Hampton-level, but the lobby computer seems to be always in use. I would check out other airport properties, but be sure you have a firm shuttle commitment.
reviews.title: A little shopworn........

reviews.text: This is your typical Hampton Inn. Nice standard, newer beds/bath. This hotel is near DIA but there is a closer group of hotels/restaurants about a mile to the north.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel for One Night Stay by DIA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in here the last night after our whirl wind trip around Vail and the Colorad Springs area. I agree with the other poster that you know exactly what you are getting with Hampton Inn and Suites....I just love staying at any Hampton around the country. The room was nice size and very clean and the bed is so comfortable...The bathroom was very adequate...We did not use the shuttle service since we rented a car and had to turn it in. Check in was very smooth...3-5 minutes max for total check in. The 2 individuals at the front desk were very polite and efficient.
reviews.title: Great One Night Stay

likes.liked: — Proximity to the airport...main reason for our stay!

reviews.text: There was free use of a computer and printer in the lobby, which was nice since I did not have access to mine for a whole week!
reviews.title: Ah, I love Hampton!

likes.liked: — great beds & breakfast for hotel chain
likes.disliked: — a little pricey as it usually is near an airport, but it was late

reviews.title: Nice New Hampton by the Airport
reviews.text: The lobby was very quaint and I enjoyed sitting down there just unwinding after our drive back to Denver. It was nice having the diner next door just to walk over and not have to get back into your car again to go and grab something to eat. The next morning the breakfast was nice and standard for Hampton's breakfast. This will be my hotel of choice next time I fly out of or into Denver again! Kudos!

My thanks to the staff of the Hampton Inn - Denver International Airport for making my stay comfortable and successful. I am a business traveler stuck in Denver with minimum luggage due to blizzard conditions in the East. The staff at the Hampton Inn were proactive in anticipating and meeting every need for making my stay comfortable and enabling me to be productive.
reviews.title: Thank you to the staff of the Hampton Inn - Denver International Airport

reviews.text: What a crummy hotel. Front desk staff were indifferent at best. Whenever I said hello, they didn't reply. One staff member was plunked in front of the loud lobby TV. They just seemed like they didn't care at all about their jobs.
reviews.title: Mediocre Hampton Inn with groucy workers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has the basic Hampton Inn thing going for it, but they didn't to anything to make it even slightly better than the bare minimum. In fact, this was subpar for any business traveler.
reviews.title: OK Typical Airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms did not have well-placed outlets for laptops or phones. None of the lamps had outlets in their bases. I had to plug my phone into the wall by the rinky dink chair and ottoman, while I had to crawl under the desk to plug my computer into the only open socket under the desk. They didn't even have a multi-plug outlet there. Lighting in the room was inadequate; it was dim. The tv is an old CRT and could not be moved (via one of those metal platform/spinners). Therefore, one cannot easily watch tv while working at the desk because of the bulky armoire in between. There is no closet in the room... just the small armoire.
reviews.title: A warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is typical Hampton, but it wasn't all that well kept up. Coffee was warm and nearly empty.
reviews.title: Excellent in every respoect
Run down and poor service
reviews.text: I booked a nonsmoking room. I called at 4pm on checkin day to let them know I would arrive between 11:30 and midnight. When I arrived at 11:30, all they had were smoking rooms and the lady at checkin did not seem to care. Her only offer was that I pack up my 2 exhausted kids and go to another hotel, which at this late hour is not an option. The room is old, rundown, stained carpet. Not at all up to the standard of a Hampton Inn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super location for Denver Airport. Everything as expected, no bumps at all. Helpful staff, clean room, great value.
reviews.title: Great Location
Everything was perfect!
reviews.text: Our stay in Denver was unexpected. Our airline did a sudden flight change, stopping in Denver for a plane switch instead of flying drirectly to Phoenix. I had taken ill in flight and when we landed in Denver I was taken to the ER at University of Colorado Hospital. Upon release, we stayed overnight at this Hampton Inn. One wants most to "go home" from a hospital experience and this was an "as close to home" experience as we could imagine. The staff was courteous, provided the items we needed, kindly answered all questions, and got us a speedy shuttle to the airport the next morning. Thank you so much!

It was late on Wed. night when I returned back to the hotel. I very much needed a FEDEX envelope and a bill of lading to send something out in the A.M. before I flew home. Cristina [the front desk clerk on that night] could not have been more helpful. She not only looked on her own, but also engaged another hotel employee by the name of George to find these items for me. And they did. Unbelievable. They both really went beyond the call of duty to satisfy my unusual request. I love Hampton Inn's.
reviews.title: Federal Express

reviews.text: Armand Carpentier - 12475 Westfield Lakes Circle - Winter Garden, FL 34787
reviews.title: Continued declining quality and customer service
Good Location Rude Staff
reviews.text: This hotel is located on hotel row near the Denver Airport.

reviews.title: Just OK
reviews.text: If you don't mind waiting hours for a bus to pick you up, they have shuttle service. Don't bother to call for a pickup they won't answer and if they do it is major inconvenience. You have to schedule the bus ride to airport way in advance and they only go once or twice an hour so plan in advance!

The front desk staff is rude and inconsiderate. You are a major bother to them! They will ignore you to talk with friends and play on the computer. Half the time they aren’t even at the front desk, they sit in the lobby feet on a table and watch TV.
reviews.title: Comfy beds, free 'net, diner with tasty food next door; what more do you need?

likes.disliked: — some of the room furniture seemed worn / dated

reviews.text: Room was nice but the banging doors at all hours of the day and night limit the ability to sleep or relax.
reviews.title: Hampton - convenient
Not the best Hampton I've stayed at
reviews.text: With so many choices don't stop here.

aka: Hampton Inn Denver - International Airport Hotel
